articles.headline: In Dwindling Days of the Race, Romney Takes a Softer Tack
articles.snippet: The evolution of Mitt Romney’s stump speech illustrates his long journey from partisanship toward the middle of American politics.
articles.abstract: The evolution of Mitt Romney’s stump speech illustrates his long journey from partisanship toward the middle of American politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Mitt Romney used to talk up the “crucial” importance of having two parents in the home, saying “a mom and dad together” have a big impact. But over the past week, he has been extolling the virtues of single mothers at every turn, holding them out as examples of Americans “living for something bigger than themselves.”

articles.headline: Airlines Begin a Laborious Comeback
articles.snippet: Airlines are struggling to get flight crews and support personnel back in place for travelers who were unlucky enough to be heading home during Hurricane Sandy.
articles.abstract: Airlines are struggling to get flight crews and support personnel back in place for travelers who were unlucky enough to be heading home during Hurricane Sandy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The airline system in the Northeast slowly started to come back to life on Wednesday, but not quickly enough for Michelle Gippin. She flew into Newark Liberty International Airport from Frankfurt two days late, and then was told she could not get a connecting flight home to Cleveland until Friday or Saturday.
articles.byline: By Robbie Brown and Christopher Drew

articles.headline: Wary of Future, Professionals Leave China in Record Numbers
articles.snippet: Although China’s economic boom has created millions of well-paying jobs, its skilled workers are moving elsewhere, in search of better quality of life, and religious and political freedoms.
articles.abstract: Although China’s economic boom has created millions of well-paying jobs, its skilled workers are moving elsewhere, in search of better quality of life, and religious and political freedoms.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — At 30, Chen Kuo had what many Chinese dream of: her own apartment and a well-paying job at a multinational corporation. But in mid-October, Ms. Chen boarded a midnight flight for Australia to begin a new life with no sure prospects.

articles.headline: Apple Shake-Up Could Lead to Design Shift
articles.snippet: A decision to fire Scott Forstall, the leader of mobile software development, means the departure of a high-ranking proponent of the visual design style for software favored by Steve Jobs.
articles.abstract: A decision to fire Scott Forstall, the leader of mobile software development, means the departure of a high-ranking proponent of the visual design style for software favored by Steve Jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whether they realize it or not, all of those who swipe a finger down from the top of the iPhone’s screen to check for notifications are bearing witness to a big sore point within Apple.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield and Nick Bilton

articles.headline: Little Federal Help for the Long-Term Unemployed
articles.snippet: Policy makers are being urged to address long-term unemployment before those looking for work decide to give up trying for good.
articles.abstract: Policy makers are being urged to address long-term unemployment before those looking for work decide to give up trying for good.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the economy-focused presidential campaign, the two candidates and their teams have scarcely mentioned what economists describe as not just one of the labor market’s most pressing problems, but the entire country’s: long-term unemployment.
articles.byline: By Annie Lowrey and Catherine Rampell
